docs.text: the central focus of michael winterbottom's " welcome to sarajevo " is sarajevo itself , the city under siege , and its different effect on the characters unfortunate enough to be stuck there .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it proves the backdrop for a stunningly realized story which refreshingly strays from mythic portents ( " platoon " ) , racial tumultuosness ( the risible " the walking dead " ) or a tinge of schmaltziness ( " schindler's list " ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the two leads , stephen dillane as a reporter and emira nusevic as an orphan with a plight few can identify with , are extremely believable ; not one moment with them involved rings false .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the question is not what went right .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the question is what went wrong .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: for one , the film fails to provide a political overview of the war as it progresses ( the dillane characters reports an american plane departing from sarajevo as it departs , and that's about it . ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the assortment of high-profile supporting actors , ranging from woody harrelson as a yankee reporter " into " liquor and cigarrettes to marisa tomei as a huggable children's aid or somesuch are incapable of rising above the sketchiness of their characters , albeit they strive .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the interrupted use of authentic war footage somewhat hampers the rest of the film , it makes the fictional characters seem powerless by comparison .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: still , winterbottom eschews mawkishness through flashy , frantic editing and imaginative use of music .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and it's a plus , because he doesn't toy with our emotions with sentimental blandness .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he wants us to know that in war , no one is victorious .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the sweet hereafter
docs.label: positive

docs.text: starring ian holm , sarah polley , bruce greenwood , tom mccamus , gabrielle rose , arsinee khanjian , alberta watson , maury chaykin , caerthan banks .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: produced by atom egoyan and camelia frieberg .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: script by atom egoyan ( based on the novel by russell banks ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: directed by atom egoyan .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: running time : 110 mins .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: atom egoyan's powerfully meditative " the sweet hereafter " is as anything as haunting and transcendental as i've seen this year .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it not only explores the aftermaths of a terrible tragedy with magnificent subtlety , with cold , and stunning shots of the backdrop of this mistfortune but also by telegraphing the sense of devastation that has permeated the small town with an enormous amount of dignity and respect for each and every soul affected .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: ian holm as the somber , lonely lawyer seeking compensation for the townspeople , has a decency and a restraint uncommon with lawyers , he's a lion for the wrong reasons : the pain for having lost his daughter ( she's a druggie who frequently calls him begging for money ) is reflected on the town .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: and in some mesmerizing flashbacks , we witness how she lost her purity .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it's one of the most strikingly breathtaking takes on the loss of innocence i've ever seen .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: but the most astounding part goes to sarah polly , the peaceful , benevolent girl who , in contrast to the other characters , remains the most mentally stable during past , present or future .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: her ability to convey concealed pain and unconditional love is the opposite , yet near-revolutionary role that won emily watson an oscar nomination for " breaking the waves " .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both women are torn apart by an extraordinary incident but it is only then that we truly see , truly feel , their wordless , omnipotent love .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: " the sweet hereafter " though , is atom egoyan's movie and as of now , he is emerging as the definite face of independent cinema .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: after surging to worldwide recognition with 1994's " exotica " , " the sweet hereafter " makes him something few people in this industry can call themselves : an artist .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: he interweaves time with a delicacy and sees a soul with a purity that is just not common .
docs.label: positive
